Full Job Description
At HPE, we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions and advance the way people live and work. Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead dedicated to helping our customers make their mark on the world.

Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.

Aruba, a Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company, is a leading provider of next-generation networking solutions for the mobile enterprise: http://www.arubanetworks.com/company/about-us. We have an exciting opportunity for a ASIC Post-Si Verification Engineering Intern to join our team in Roseville, CA.

The company designs and delivers Mobility-Defined Networks that empower IT departments and #GenMobile, a new generation of tech-savvy users who rely on their mobile devices for every aspect of work and personal communication. To create a mobility experience that #GenMobile and IT can rely upon, Aruba Mobility-Defined Networks™ automate infrastructure-wide performance optimization and trigger security actions that used to require manual IT intervention. The results are dramatically improved productivity and lower operational costs.

Responsibilities:
The intern will be working with the HPE Aruba ASIC development team on next generation products. You will have a summer project that will be used for/in the development activities of current or future ASIC's. This ASIC team develops state of the art, world class Networking Chips for the marketplace and our customers. We are looking for individuals that have the desire and ability to contribute at this level. The intern will be working with and learning from the senior members of the ASIC / VLSI team. Responsibilities may include RTL/Physical Design, Pre-Silicon verification; Post-Silicon verification; Formal Verification; Script &/or Tool development; schedule breakdowns, document generation, and several other possible duties. Several assignments are possible, so final alignment will be based on student skills and business needs.

Education and Experience Required:
Must be currently enrolled in a 4 year University/College pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent.

At least 3rd Year of engineering courses completed (2023 graduate).

Experience with scripting languages (Python, PERL, TCL or equivalent)

Experience with hardware design

Experience with software programming languages (C; C++)

Experience with Verilog

Skills Needed:
Desire to learn and contribute
Result oriented and self-motivation
Good communication skills
Ability to work within a team environment

What we can offer you :Extensive benefits, a competitive salary and participation in the shared values and purpose that make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers! At HPE, our goal is to provide equal opportunities, flexible work-life balance, and constantly evolving career growth. If you are looking for challenges in an exciting supportive work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Continue the conversation by clicking apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers.Join us and make your mark!Find out more about us and follow us on:https://www.facebook.com/HPECareershttps://twitter.com/HPE_CareersHPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together

1090454

This role has been designated as ‘Office’, which means you will primarily work from an HPE office.

Full Job Description
KEB AMERICA, Inc., a growing global manufacturer of automation and motion control products, is currently seeking a student for a position as a Software Design Intern.

KEB has an exciting opportunity to learn and grow in our Engineering Department. As a Software Design Engineer Intern you will acquire knowledge and develop skills, while working on projects with the Software Engineering Team. This position will assist with the test and validation process via test system software development and testing.

Responsibilities may include:
Test and verification of software functionality
Development and testing of new validation software based on specifications
Documentation and modeling of new software functions
Modifying and refactoring existing software
Ability to follow code execution and identify the resulting functionality

Education / Experience:
Enrolled in a professional degree in the field of Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering or related field with a GPA >= 3.0
C programming experience
Python programming experience
Experience with embedded system design
Experience with file repositories such as Git

Specific Technical Skills (May be learned on the job):
Familiarization with industrial programming language IEC 61131-3
Programming Languages: C, C#, Python, and scripting
Gitlab
Confluence, Jira
Familiarization with UML
Basic understanding of variable speed drives and control systems
Embedded systems

Full Job Description
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

SUMMARY
ANSYS empowers the world's most innovative companies to design and deliver transformational products by offering the best and broadest engineering simulation software to solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Thus, through our enriching co-op andintern program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists.You will develop our industry-leading simulation software while gaining real experience in your field of study. You will support Office of CTOfor contributing to researching and implementing new algorithms for machine learning models in context of numerical methods, simulations and 3D understanding using deep learning and other related fields.

This Internship is a 40-hour per week paid position starting May 2022and concluding August 2022.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Design and develop machine learning algorithms for training using our ANSYS solvers as surrogates for CAE applications
  • Create datasets, label data and train machine learning algorithms using deep learning or reinforcement learning techniques.
  • Implement solutions in experimental code (Python, TensorFlow, Pytorch) using industry best practices in software development.
  • Test the algorithms developed and share results and training curves.
  • Design and develop code with Unit Testing and TDD (test driven design) based on specific list of engineering scenarios.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Enrolled in a MS or PhD program pursuing degree in engineering, mathematics or computer science.
  • Experience with machine learning using scripting languages such as Python/R and GPU programming.
  • Experience with statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models, and sampling methods.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Preferred experience using machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or Pytorch
  • Preferred experience in machine learning using 3D and geometry
  • Preferred experience using 3d software for datasets creation
  • Preferred experience Object-oriented languages such as C++ and/or C#
  • Preferred experience with source control such as GIT, SVN
CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:

Customer focus
Results and Accountability
Innovation
Transparency and Integrity
Mastery
Inclusiveness
Sense of urgency
Collaboration and Teamwork

WORKING AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Full Job Description
Summary:
CSX Technology is seeking interns for a 12+ week immersion into our organization. Individuals will complete challenging assignments in a collaborative team environment directly contributing to innovation, transformation, and delivery of corporate results. Our internships provide an opportunity for candidates to preview full-time opportunities at CSX, gain practical experience, and build professional networks.

Primary Activities and Responsibilities:
Interns will be placed with a technology team based on their skills, aspirations, and active company initiatives. Possible teams include: Applications Development (Java and Angular web development), Data Science & Analytics, Cybersecurity, Agile Delivery, Software Infrastructure (including Automation and Cloud), User Experience, IT Operations, Integrations/API, Project Management, Robotics/Drones, GIS, Field Infrastructure, and Service Support.

Regardless of team placement, all technology interns play an important role in advancing and delivering Technology initiatives. The expectations of these compensated positions include, but are not limited to:

Active contribution in a dynamic, agile team environment
Adherence to best practices for developing and maintaining secure systems
Root-cause analysis to iterate improvement and increase reliability and efficiency
Engagement across teams and stakeholders, to ensure shared understanding and value delivery

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
Must be at least 18 years of age
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related major field of study from an accredited institution.
Cumulative minimum GPA of 3.0 (based on a 4-point scale)

Preferred Qualifications:
Cumulative GPA of 3.3 (based on a 4-point scale)

Knowledge and Skills:
Knowledge of web (angular/java) programming concepts and technologies
Knowledge of relational and/or graph database concepts and functions
Knowledge of Agile, DEVOPS, cybersecurity, and integration practices and concepts
Knowledge of hardware, desktop, network, and field infrastructure components
Strong collaboration, communication, interpersonal, and influence skills
Problem-solving, analysis, organizational, and time management skills

Job Requirements:
Communicate effectively and professionally with peers, leadership, stakeholder audiences
Work within established deadlines
Willing and able to work days and hours as assigned
Successfully complete a background check and drug test

Environmental Conditions:
Work inside an office environment

Our Commitment to Operate Safely:
Led by our Guiding Principles, CSX is committed to protecting its employees, customers and the communities in which we operate. Therefore, as a condition of employment, successful candidates for all management positions, train dispatchers and crew dispatchers will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination before the candidate’s start of employment. Proof of COVID-19 vaccination must be provided during the onboarding process. Should the successful candidate seek an exemption from vaccination for a medical reason, a contraindication, or a sincerely held religious belief, appropriate documentation must be provided in support of such request.

Company Profile:
CSX Corporation, a Fortune 500 company headquartered in Jacksonville, FL, is a multi-modal freight transportation company serving customers across North America. Through its primary subsidiary, CSX operates the largest railroad in the eastern United States with operations in 23 states, the District of Columbia, and two Canadian provinces. CSX also includes an integrated intermodal company which serves customers with its own truck and terminal operations as well as a dedicated domestic container fleet. Other CSX subsidiaries provide technology and real estate support to the company. These subsidiaries combine to allow CSX to deliver efficient freight alternatives to customers in a variety of industries, including coal, chemicals, automobiles, metals, agricultural and forest products, food and consumer goods.

Closing Statement
At CSX, two of the company's core values are People Make The Difference and Safety Is A Way of Life. We are committed to offering our team members the most competitive compensation and benefits package available, unlimited opportunities for development and growth throughout an exciting and rewarding career, and the safest work environment possible.

CSX is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Any resumes submitted by an outside vendor to any employee at CSX via e-mail, Internet, or directly to hiring managers without a valid written search agreement in place with the Talent Acquisition / HR department will be deemed the sole property of CSX. No placement fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired as a result of the referral, or through other means.

Full Job Description
GRAINGER OVERVIEW

At Grainger, we’re committed to our purpose – We Keep the World Working. Grainger is a leading global supplier of maintenance, repair, and operational supplies, providing services and solutions for every industry. Our 23,000 employees are driven to serve customers and the community in exceptional ways; focusing on delivering the highest level of service leveraging the most innovative solutions. In the Grainger Technology Group, we deliver the technology platforms, systems, and services that power the Grainger business. As part of a high-performing team, you’ll be able to develop your talents and make a difference. Grainger is a Fortune 500 company and a perennial member of Fortune magazine's Most Admired Companies list.

THE PROGRAM

The GTG internship is a 10-week program based out of our downtown Chicago office. You will work alongside team members on functionality that has a direct impact on the business. Throughout the summer, there will be plenty of time for networking, professional development, and social events. At the end of the internship, you will present your work to senior leadership.

The internship is paid and free housing is provided in downtown Chicago for all Grainger Technology Group interns. At this time, we plan for our 2022 internship program to take place in person. However, we are actively monitoring the COVID-19 pandemic and will take all necessary steps to ensure team member safety.

THE ROLE

We are looking for analysts with strong technical and analytical skills as well as strong interpersonal and effective communication skills. You will contribute your skills to a specific team and may have the opportunity to work with your intern peers on additional projects. Through your work and other development opportunities, you will grow your technical skills and understand how our technology stack empowers our business to serve our customers.

Responsibilities

Gather data to support technical recommendations to address problems
Write user stories and ensure the integrity of stories across projects
Define, perform and document basic functional configuration activities
Collaborate on a team operating in an Agile development context
Demonstrate strong analytical skills; Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
Display a proactive, results-oriented attitude; superb work ethic, and flexibility to work in an environment of constant change

Qualifications

Preferably pursuing a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems related field.
Ability to grasp business and technical concepts quickly
Preferred major GPA of 3.0 or higher
Expected graduation with a Bachelors or Masters degree between Winter 2022 – Spring 2023
Does not require sponsorship

Grainger is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Full Job Description

Novobi is an ERP Consulting firm that has been growing consistently by more than 60% per year over the last 5 years. We have 50+ talents and an artisanship culture. We are proud of our multi-year, 100% project-success and customer-retention rates that are fueled by our core values of integrity, artisanship, commitment, and teamwork.

Our clients are mostly fast-growing SMEs in the Retail, Manufacturing, and Services industries. We help them define and execute digital transformation strategies using Enterprise Resource Planning software (ERP), Cloud Computing, and Data Science.

We are a Gold Partner of Odoo, an ERP company that has received over $300 million in funding and has been growing at an average of over 60% per year for the last 10+ years. We are also a partner of Amazon Cloud (AWS).

About the Role

This is an entry-level position that will allow you to build a career path in the premier ERP Consulting areas. The Associate/Intern Sales Representative will be involved in ERP product analysis, ERP requirement analysis, market research, marketing initiatives, business development, and sales activities.

Novobi offers a flexible, 100% remote working environment. We encourage business or IT major students to apply and will do our best to support your school schedule.

What you will do

  • Work with Sales and Marketing leaders to define strategies and sales plan to win new ERP clients.
  • Develop and execute account penetration strategies.
  • Recognize business needs for digital transformation and can communicate effectively the benefits an ERP solution can deliver.
  • Understand Odoo product offerings and be able to perform high-level gap analysis (mapping business requirements to product offerings)
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with key customer stakeholders in order to ensure customer success and identify new opportunities.

Requirements

  • Detail-oriented, quality mindset, and strong critical thinking skills.
  • Pursuing or hold a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or equivalent.

Nice to have

  • Experience in the Retail or Manufacturing industry.
  • Experience in the IT consulting industry.
  • Experience with ERP software (Odoo, NetSuite, Acumatica, BrightPearl, Infor, Epicor, IQMS, Sage, etc.).
  • Pursuing or hold a Master’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or equivalent.

What's great about this job?

  • Challenging and impactful works: help US businesses execute digital transformation strategies to grow their business.
  • Great career path to join the premier ERP Consulting workforce.
  • Flexible working hours.
  • Get real responsibilities and autonomy.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Pay: $20.00 - $35.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Employee assistance program
  • Flexible schedule
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Paid training
  • Parental leave
  • Travel reimbursement
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay

Experience:

  • Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Work Location: Remote

Full Job Description

Overview: SMG – Service Management Group is looking for a Data Science Intern for summer 2022!

As a summer intern on our Data Science team, you’ll see code you write go live every week, analyzing and acting on data received from hundreds of thousands of consumers. Through this opportunity, Big Data philosophies and software will be applied to integrate these data feeds and support more efficient and effective business decision-making. Successful applicants can expect to work closely with a mentor to apply a variety of machine learning and data science methods, including deep learning & natural language processing, to real-world business problems.

Here at SMG, we are more than just an experience management software platform; we aim to inspire experiences that improve people’s lives. We are a catalyst for change—helping organizations generate new revenue, grow existing revenue, reduce churn and detractors, and drive operational efficiencies. Our unique software with a service (SwaS) model puts a dual focus on platform technology and professional services, making it easy for brands to activate insights based on customer, patient, and employee feedback.

SMG embraces our collective differences as human beings. We celebrate diversity and create an inclusive work environment in which all employees experience belonging, have their unique needs respected and met, have equal access to opportunities and resources, and feel fully engaged to contribute to the company’s success.

Responsibilities

  • Work with a mentor on the data science team to complete an applied machine learning project

Qualifications

  • Ideal candidates will be working toward a BS or an MS degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related science/engineering field.
  • Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and statistics
  • Experience with Python and SQL
  • Familiarity with data science and machine learning concepts
  • Experience with Python data science & machine learning libraries such as Scikit-learn, PyTorch, Pandas, and Numpy is preferred.

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Work Location: Multiple Locations

Full Job Description
The Employee Experience Internship position provides an opportunity for students who are currently pursuing a computer science degree, to get hands on experience working with skilled support engineers and infrastructure specialists in a support environment. The intern will contribute to various hands on projects across the North America region and help to manage resource allocations, prioritization of initiatives, progress reports and project planning meetings. The position starts in June, paid working 40 hours per week through August. Opportunity exists for this position to continue through the academic year on a part-time basis to allow for class schedules.

Essential Functions

  • Support a variety of infrastructure and support initiatives across various sites
  • Help to coordinate onsite visits to execute local projects
  • Help facilitate meetings with the internal teams and business partners
  • Learn about operational IT support with a large focus on Employee Experience through daily activities
  • Accept candid feedback and look for areas of improvements
  • Specific tasks will be tailored to the intern’s experience level and abilities
  • An Employee Experience intern works under the close supervision of North America Employee Experience Director, regional support managers, project managers, and IT technicians
Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
  • Ability to learn, be mentored, and improve
  • Desire to contribute and improve current processes
  • Exceptional customer focus
  • Desire to coordinate tasks across multiple geographic teams
Qualifications

  • Minimum 3.5 GPA preferred
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

Full Job Description
Summary of Major Responsibilities:
Through hands-on experience as well as observational and mentorship activities, the IT Intern will have the opportunity to learn about several aspects of Information Security and working in a real business environment.

Primary responsibilities will be involved with day-to-day security operations, including access audits, role validation, response to security events, and general monitoring of security tools. This role will also help monitor compliance with all security policies and standards as well as with applicable regulations and laws.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Evaluation and remediation of customer-initiated incident tickets on information security topics (reported phishing e-mails, blocked web sites, etc.).
User account administration (Provisioning / de-provisioning, account permissions & auditing in a Microsoft Active Directory integrated environment).
Assisting fellow employees with the installation and use of a variety of information security-related applications.
Assistance in the development of documentation, user guides, FAQs and presentation materials related to information security topics and tools.
Act as a problem solver to drive successful completion of assigned tasks.
Establish positive working relationships with team members, vendors and IT customers.
Friendly and positive demeanor with a desire to demonstrate the high standards of customer service.
Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.
Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures.
Regular and reliable attendance.
May be required to lift 10lbs on an infrequent basis up to 20% of the time.

description:
Full Job Description
Embedded in a worldwide network Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America continuously strives to remain at the forefront of successful automotive research and development. MBRDNA is headquartered in Silicon Valley, California, with key areas of Autonomous Driving, Advanced Interaction Design, Digital User Experience, Machine Learning, Customer Research, and Open Innovation. In Redford, Michigan, the focus is on Powertrain and eDrive technology as well as in Long Beach, where the teams test durability of the latest driver assistant and telematic systems. The Digital Hub in Seattle focusses on developing a cloud architecture and building out the cloud platform for the next generation of connected car services. The Testing and Regulatory Affairs Division in Ann Arbor and the Advanced Vehicle Design in Carlsbad complete the competence center.

We are looking for highly motivated and skilled engineering interns to help develop our strategic products in Experience AI Cloud team for next-generation Mercedes-Benz vehicles at our R&D headquarters in Sunnyvale, CA. This role will work closely with our software development teams to define and implement software architectures on the latest automotive cloud platforms.

The Cloud Software Engineer Intern will build Domains, Apps and Tools for the MBUX Voice Assistant (#HeyMercedes). The engineering intern will contribute, as part of a team, to parts of the software development lifecycle, including development of software prototypes, writing documentation and specifications, participating in software design and code reviews, developing software and product maintenance.

Job Responsibilities:
Evaluate new features and system requirements by developing working prototypes.
Design, implement, and test reusable software components for cloud platforms.
Write software documentation and specifications, as necessary.
Integrate and test software in prototyping cars or demonstration hardware.
Participate in an Agile working model.
Effectively collaborate with other engineers, designers, user experience experts, and researchers.

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Software/Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
Software development experience with Node.js, RESTful API, MySQL, and/or NoSQL.
Basic understanding of operating systems and computer architecture fundamentals.
Ability to analyze complex problems, recognizes and explains connections between cause-and-effect understandably and develops concrete, viable solutions taking risks and obstacles into account.
Ability to manage competing project priorities and constraints.
Ability to analyze internal/external technology trends and developments. Active participation in collaborative opportunities to gain skills in new areas to support other team members.
Ability to work in inter-cultural, inter-disciplinary teams across multiple time zones.
Evaluate new features and system requirements by developing working prototypes.
Design, implement, and test reusable software components for cloud platforms.
Write software documentation and specifications, as necessary.
Integrate and test software in prototyping cars or demonstration hardware.
Debug and analyze the performance and system resource usage of software components.
Participate in an Agile working model together with development teams in various time zones.
Effectively collaborate with other engineers, designers, user experience experts, and researchers.
Valid California Driver License.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in agile collaboration models (e.g. Scrum)
Experience in developing voice applications e.g. for Houndify, Cerence, Alexa and Google Assistant
Advanced coding skills in JavaScript, Go, Java

At Marvell, we believe that infrastructure powers progress. That execution is as essential as innovation. That better collaboration builds better technology. Full Job Description
Company Description

As the world’s leader in digital payments technology, Visa’s mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company’s dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You’re an Individual. We’re the team for you. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.

Job Description

This Intern role is within the Visa DPS Risk Services team. The Risk Services provides a suite of Payment System risk mitigation tools and services for our Issuer processing clients, and with these tools and services, delivers fraud rates 27% lower than Visa US Debit average. Performance measurement and analytics represents a key differentiator in our competitive performance advantages, enabling us to continually identify opportunities and hone in on areas to target that enable us to continually build on our performance differentiation to the benefit of our clients.

This intern will have the opportunity to work with our Risk and Disputes analytics professionals, developing and deploying data-driven insights and propelling our risk strategies. The position will also evaluate analytics-based solutions to automate key processes including client performance scorecards, client billing, and client performance insights for cross-functional management.

Essential Functions

Develop and maintain standard and customized operational and fraud performance insights across various measures
Provide analytical insights and data visualizations for Visa clients, team members and other internal resources
Research and implement better methods to streamline data collection and reporting efforts
Work effectively with internal/external resources to define analytical objectives, data requirements, obtain data and perform in-depth analyses to achieve a defined business objective
Build out client performance insights and measurements against industry benchmarks with an eye to identifying opportunity for performance improvements and/or increased profitability
Develop a comprehensive understanding of all Visa products and services

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Undergrad Intern

Pursuing a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, CIS/MIS, Cybersecurity, Business or a related field, graduating December 2022 or later
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
Work Authorization: Permanent Authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment for this position. Visa will not sponsor applicants for work visas in connection with this position. Future sponsorship will not be considered.
Strong communications skills, specifically, the absence of repeated grammatical or typographical errors, clear and concise written and spoken communications, and communications that demonstrate professional judgment.

Preferred Qualifications

Advanced Tableau Desktop and Server skills a plus
Strong background and skills with ETL systems, with Alteryx as preferred platform.
SAS experience: proficiency and continuous skills development in leading edge analytic tools, e.g. SAS OR, Tableau, Hands on Hadoop experience is a plus
The ability to take on challenges and address problems head-on
Strong ability to collaborate
Highly driven, resourceful and results oriented
Good team player and excellent interpersonal skills
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to lead and navigate through ambiguity

Additional Information

Work Authorization

Permanent Authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment for this position. Visa will not sponsor applicants for work visas in connection with this position. Future sponsorship will not be considered.

Work Hours:
This position requires the incumbent to be available during core business hours.

Travel Requirements:
This position requires the incumbent to travel for work less than 10% of the time.

Physical Requirements:
This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. The Viasat Global Network and Technology security team is responsible for all aspects of security as it relates to our broadband satellite communications systems. The intern assignments will provide exposure to the basics of secure systems, and especially the manner in which automation plays a critical role.

Full Job Description
The United Nations Forum on Forests Secretariat (UNFFS), Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA) is accepting applications for internships.
The UNFFS provides leadership in promoting the implementation of the United Nations Strategic Plan for Forests (UNSPF) and the achievement of its Global Forest Goals, and the effective implementation of the UN Forest Instrument. It provides substantive secretariat support to the United Nations Forum on Forests (UNFF), which is composed of all Member States of the United Nations and specialized agencies.
In 2015, the UNFF established the Global Forest Financing Facilitation Network under the UNFFS to facilitate access to and effective use of funding for forests, sharing data and best practices on forest financing and contributing to the achievement of the Global Forest Goals of the UN Strategic Plan for Forests 2030. More information on the UNFFS and the GFFFN can be found at www.un.org/esa/forests.
The prospective intern should have a background in economics, environmental issues, data science, or computer science-related areas. Experience or knowledge of IT-related work is desirable. The internship is for three months, with an opportunity for extension up to a maximum of six (6) months, depending on the needs of the Office.
The internship is UNPAID and full-time. Interns work five days per week (35 hours) under the supervision of a staff member in the department or office to which they are assigned.

For more information about the Office, please see https://www.un.org/esa/forests/

Responsibilities

The selected intern(s) will be responsible for one or more of the following duties in support of the work of the UNFF and its Global Forest Financing Facilitation Network (GFFFN), depending on his/her education background:

1.Conduct desk research and collect information on forest financing. This would include information on financing opportunities, learning materials and good practices at international level;
2.Conduct desk study on the existing data and datasources on financing flow for forests;
3.Assist in drafting and entering data entries into the website of the UNFF Clearing House on Forest Financing;
4.Assist in preparing news letters, analytical papers, issue briefs and other written documents on forest financing, for publication through the website of the UNFF Clearing House on Forest Financing.
5.Assist in website development and updates for the website of the UN Forum on Forests, using WordPress and Drupal;
6.Assist in preparations for the seventeenth session of the United Nations Forum on Forests (UNFF17) and its preparatory work.
7.Perform other duties as assigned.

Competencies

The United Nations Core Competencies include:
  • Communication: Ability to draft clearly and concisely, good written and oral language
skills.
  • Teamwork: Good interpersonal skills, ability to work collaboratively with colleagues from different national and cultural backgrounds to achieve organisational goals.
  • Client Orientation: Considers all those to whom services are provided to be 'clients' and
seeks to see things from clients' point of view.

The intern is expected to:
Have a demonstrated keen interest in the work of the United Nations and have a personal commitment to the ideals of the Charter; and
Have demonstrated the ability to successfully interact with individuals of different cultural backgrounds and beliefs, which include willingness to try and understand and be tolerant of differing opinions and views.

Education

To qualify for an internship with the United Nations Internship Programme, the following conditions must be met:

Applicants must meet one of the following requirements:
(a)be enrolled in a graduate school programme (second university degree or equivalent, or higher);
(b)be enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (minimum Bachelor's level or equivalent); or
(c)have graduated with a university degree (as defined above) and, if selected, must commence the internship within a one year period of graduation;
  • Be computer literate in standard software applications.
  • Knowledge of issues in the context of sustainable development would be an advantage.
Languages

English and French are the working languages of the United Nations Secretariat. Fluency in spoken and written English is required for the Internship Programme. Knowledge of additional official United Nations language is an asset. Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian and Spanish are the official languages of the United Nations Secretariat.

Assessment

Potential candidates will be contacted by the hiring manager directly for further consideration.

Special Notice

In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, interns may be requested to undertake the internship remotely in view of constraints regarding visa issuance, international travel and access to UN premises. The intern must be willing and prepared to undertake the internship remotely for a part or the entirety of the internship. The work hours during the internship shall be determined based on individual discussion between the intern and the supervisor(s) taking into consideration the minimum requirements of the Organization and the time difference between the hosting office and the location of the intern.

A completed online application (Cover Note and Personal History Profile) is required.
Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.

The Cover Note must include:
  • Degree Programme (What are you currently studying?)
  • Graduation Date (When will you graduate or when did you graduate from the programme?)
  • List the IT skills and programmes that you are proficient in.
United Nations Considerations

According to article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter of the United Nations, the paramount consideration in the employment of the staff is the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. Candidates will not be considered for employment with the United Nations if they have committed violations of international human rights law, violations of international humanitarian law, sexual exploitation, sexual abuse, or sexual harassment, or if there are reasonable grounds to believe that they have been involved in the commission of any of these acts. The term “sexual exploitation” means any actual or attempted abuse of a position of vulnerability, differential power, or trust, for sexual purposes, including, but not limited to, profiting monetarily, socially or politically from the sexual exploitation of another. The term “sexual abuse” means the actual or threatened physical intrusion of a sexual nature, whether by force or under unequal or coercive conditions. The term “sexual harassment” means any unwelcome conduct of a sexual nature that might reasonably be expected or be perceived to cause offence or humiliation, when such conduct interferes with work, is made a condition of employment or creates an intimidating, hostile or offensive work environment, and when the gravity of the conduct warrants the termination of the perpetrator’s working relationship. Candidates who have committed crimes other than minor traffic offences may not be considered for employment.

Due regard will be paid to the importance of recruiting the staff on as wide a geographical basis as possible. The United Nations places no restrictions on the eligibility of men and women to participate in any capacity and under conditions of equality in its principal and subsidiary organs. The United Nations Secretariat is a non-smoking environment.

The paramount consideration in the appointment, transfer, or promotion of staff shall be the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. By accepting an offer of appointment, United Nations staff members are subject to the authority of the Secretary-General and assignment by him or her to any activities or offices of the United Nations in accordance with staff regulation 1.2 (c). In this context, all internationally recruited staff members shall be required to move periodically to discharge new functions within or across duty stations under conditions established by the Secretary-General.

Applicants are urged to follow carefully all instructions available in the online recruitment platform, inspira. For more detailed guidance, applicants may refer to the Manual for the Applicant, which can be accessed by clicking on “Manuals” hyper-link on the upper right side of the inspira account-holder homepage.

The evaluation of applicants will be conducted on the basis of the information submitted in the application according to the evaluation criteria of the job opening and the applicable internal legislations of the United Nations including the Charter of the United Nations, resolutions of the General Assembly, the Staff Regulations and Rules, administrative issuances and guidelines. Applicants must provide complete and accurate information pertaining to their personal profile and qualifications according to the instructions provided in inspira to be considered for the current job opening. No amendment, addition, deletion, revision or modification shall be made to applications that have been submitted. Candidates under serious consideration for selection will be subject to reference checks to verify the information provided in the application.

Job openings advertised on the Careers Portal will be removed at 11:59 p.m. (New York time) on the deadline date.

No Fee

THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS (APPLICATION, INTERVIEW MEETING, PROCESSING, OR TRAINING). THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CONCERN ITSELF WITH INFORMATION ON APPLICANTS’ BANK ACCOUNTS.
